bboxes.raw_text:
You can expect lots of exciting
new hobby kits to show up in the
stores this spring and summer.
More than 200 manufacturers
previewed their new ideas at the
9th annual trade show Of the
Hobby Industry Association of
America, Inc, early in February.


Some notes from the show:
"Big" kits like Monogram Mod
els, Ines one-eighth-size cars,
are here to stay; slot and road
racing will continue to gain pop
ularity; there will be an increas-
ing number of CRAZY off beat
car kits; science and electronic
kits continue to grow in variety
and sophistication-you can even
build your own computer.


The famous Hawker Hurricane
fighter plane that played such
tremendous role in the Battle of
Britain has been added to Mono
grams collection Of World War
II fighter bombers. The Hurri-
cane was the RATS first fighter
monoplane and it's first fighter to
do better than 800 miles an hour.
Monogram's kit includes extra
parts so you can assemble the
plane in one of five different YER
sions produced before the end of
the war. Working parts include
fully retractable landing gear
and there is large sheet of de-
Gals with markings for each of
the five optional versions.


+ x


Photo fans can create a dra-
matte effect next time they make
a portrait of their favorite date.
Print it on red, blue or gold
toned paper. Girls, for instance,
look misty-by-moonlight on blue
toned paper.

WASHINCTON-The Office of
Education Is searching for a
builtin tranquilizer to calm the
nerves of jittery public speakers,
nervous actors and frightened
students.


The agency has awarded a
$1,000 research contract to the
University of Illinois to find out
what causes stage fright and how
to cure it.


The university will make a
years study of 100 students who
become extremely nervous and
tense when called upon to speak
in public.


Educators call this symptom
performance anxiety. Investiga-
ton has shown that it seriously
affects some students successes
on examinations or other scho-
lastic problems.

SEARCH ON TO
END STAGE FRIGHT

Women who prefer "open air"
drying say that sunny cold day
is good day for hanging out the
wash.


Remember their tips for winter
time line drying: wash wire
clotheslines with steel wool, fol-
lowed by sudsy cloth; tuck a hot
water bottle into the clothespin
bag to keep your hands warm;
suds and rinse clothespins, then
soak them in salt solution so they
won't freeze to the clothes; and
take the laundry in as soon as it
is dry enough to iron.

Total employment in Arizona
reached a new high at mid
December as unemployment de-
clined slightly.


A total of 4o4,2OO persons
were employed in the state last
month reported the Employment
Security Commission.


This is $500 increase from
mid-November.


The gain in total jobs was in
nonfarm employment with agri-
cultural jobs remaining constant
at 200.


Unemployment at mid-Decem-
Der total an estimated 5000,
some 1000 less than on the same
date in 1862 and 200 less than
at mid-November.


Arizona unemployment COM
prised 4.8 per cent of the state S
labor force compared to a ma
tionwide rate of SIS per cent.

Reese Werner has been named
president Of Bayless Markets,
Inc, it was announced this week
by A. j. Bayless, board chair
man and retiring president.


Werner, associated with Bay
less for "a years, has been
executive vice president and gen.
eral manager of the Arizona
firm since 1862.


Bayless said, "Reese Werner
has been with our company since
the. first store opened in Sep
TENDER, 1880. He is eminently
qualified to assume this new
position. Under his management,
am confident the company will
continue to grow and prosper.
Since l have spent my entire
working life in the grocery busi-
ness, ! now feel l should devote
my time to my family and other
business interests"


Werner began his career at age
10 as a part-time stock boy for
the TIM. Butcher store at Five
Points in West Phoenix. Shortly
afterward the store was pur-
chased by A. ]. Bayless, then
Fl years old. Bayless developed
the single store into one of the
nations so largest food chains
with As retail stores employing
1900 people.


Werner said the companys
success must be attributed to
the untiring efforts of Al. Bay
less. The companys position as
Arizona's largest food retailer
is the product of his merchan-
dising SKILL"

KING STON, Jamaica The
Prime Minister Of Jamaica, Sir
Alexander Bustamante, became
a life member Of the National
Association for the Advancement
of Colored People when he ac-
cepted a gold Life Membership
lapel pin and a Life Member
ship plaque in a brief ceremony
at his Ministry here.


The pin was presented to Sir
Alexander by the American Am
bassador to Jamaica, William
Doherty, and the plaque by Col
in Cromwell, NAACP field Sec
rotary.


World notables who are NAACP
life members include Jawaharlal
Nehru, the Prime Minister Of
India, who has been a longtime
NAACP stalwart: the Aga Khan
w and his brother Sadruddin Aga
Khan of India; Alan Patton, South
African author; and Laurin Car
dinal Rugambwa Of Nigeria.


"The fact that the Prime Min
lister has become a life member
Of the NAACP," commented Mr..
Cromwell, Indicates a closer
relationship between Jamaica and
the Negro community in the
United States.


eft ais Identifies Jamaica with
the aspirations Of those Jamai-
cans who now call America their
home,' he added.

JAMAICAN LEADER
BECOMES NAACP
LIFE MEMBER

Il Mrs. Helen Ruman. 56l5 N.
'oIlth Ave.. has been named Mar
icopa County ticket chairman for
the Jefferson Jackson Day dinner
spoons ored by the Democratic
Party Of Arizona, Feb. %.


Mrs. Ruman, vice chairwoman
of the Maricopa County Demo-
cratic Central Committee, was
appointed by County Chairman
Vincent D. Maggiore to orga-
nize the sale of the $25-per-
plate tickets through the 40 leg
qislative district chairmen.


'po The dinner meet will feature
~ S. Sen. Carl Hayden, Secre-
tary Of Interior Stewart L.Udall,
and Reps. Norris K. Udall and
George F. Senner, Jr. 1t will
be held In the Hotel Westward
Ho Thunderbird Room. Proceeds
are to be shared by the state
and various county organizations.


Ticket headquarters are at the
regular county headquarters at
429 W. Washington St.

DEMOCRATS TO
SPONSOR JEFFERSON-
JACKSON DINNER

When using steel wool to re-
finish antique furniture, wear an
old oven mitt to save wear and
tear on the hands and to protect
them from the paint remover.
Launder the mitt in hot suds,
ready for repeated hard-service
use.

REPORT MADE
